string-array.name: descs
string-array.item: "\tCats are a small, carnivorous mammal. They are valued by humans for companionship and for their ability to hunt vermin. Cats posses a strong flexible body, quick reflexes, sharp claws, and teeth adapted to killing small prey.

"\tCows are commonly raised as livestock for meat, as dairy animals for milk and other dairy products, and as draft animals. Other products include leather and dung for manure or fuel. In some regions, cows have significant religious meaning.
"\tDucks are aquatic birds and may be found in both fresh water and sea water. Ducks eat a variety of food sources such as grasses, aquatic plants, fish, insects etc.

"\tFrogs are short-bodied tailless amphibians. Frogs are widely distributed, ranging from the tropics to subarctic regions.Frogs lay their eggs in water. The eggs hatch into aquatic larvae called tadpoles that have tails and internal gills. "

"\tChickens are one of the most common domestic animals. Humans keep them as a source of food (meat and eggs) and as pets. Chickens are omnivores that scratch at the soil looking for seeds, insects and even animals like small snakes."

"\tLions are generalist hypercarnivores and usually hunt in groups. They typically inhabit grasslands and savannahs, but are absent in dense forest. A lion pride consists of a few adult males, related females and cubs."

"\tMonkeys are tree-dwelling primates, which are considered to be intelligent. The many species of monkey have varied relationships with humans. Some are kept as pets, others used as model organisms in laboratories or in space missions. "

"\tMouse is a small rodent characteristically having a pointed snout, small rounded ears, a body-length scaly tail and a high breeding rate. It is also a popular pet. They are known to invade homes for food and shelter."
"\tPigs are a large, even-toed ungulate. They are farmed primarily for the consumption of their meat. The animal's bones, hide, and bristles are also used in commercial products."
"\tSheep are a quadrupedal, ruminant mammal typically kept as livestock. Sheep are raised for fleece, meat (lamb, hogget or mutton) and milk. A sheep's wool is the most widely used animal fiber."
"\tSnakes are elongated, legless, carnivorous reptiles covered in overlapping scales. Snakes are able to swallow prey much larger than their heads with their highly mobile jaws."
